intro: Eschweilera cabrerana, commonly known as the cabrerana, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the Andean region of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its bark is smooth and dark in color. Eschweilera cabrerana is often found in humid, shaded environments within montane forests.
